decision_log.title: Repository Structure for Research Documentation
decision_log.description: Decided to organize the repository as a documentation-only project focused on YuiQuery research rather than executable code
decision_log.decision: Structure repository with research documents, bibliography, literature review, and supporting images
decision_log.rationale: This is an academic research project documenting a whitepaper on natural language to SQL in healthcare
alternatives_considered: Separate repositories for code and research

decision_log.title: Documentation Format Selection
decision_log.description: Selected Markdown format for all research documentation
decision_log.decision: Use Markdown (.md) files for all research documents including bibliography and literature review
decision_log.rationale: Markdown provides good readability, version control compatibility, and academic formatting capabilities

decision_log.title: License Selection
decision_log.description: Selected MIT License for open research sharing
decision_log.decision: Apply MIT License to research materials
decision_log.rationale: Promotes open access to healthcare research while maintaining attribution requirements

decision_log.decision: Merge separate YuiQuery research documents into single comprehensive paper.md
decision_log.rationale: Consolidating bibliography, literature review, and research findings into a single academic paper improves coherence, citation management, and publication readiness
alternatives: Keep separate research documents with cross-references
Create multiple specialized papers for different audiences
Maintain modular structure with master document
decision_log.tradeoffs: Gained: coherent narrative, easier citation management, publication-ready format. Lost: modular flexibility for reusing individual sections

decision_log.decision: Transform generic whitepaper template into healthcare analytics research paper
decision_log.rationale: Existing paper.md template provided good academic structure but needed healthcare-specific content and evidence-based approach
alternatives: Start with blank document
Use LaTeX academic template
Adapt from healthcare journal templates
decision_log.tradeoffs: Gained: professional academic structure, pandoc compatibility. Lost: some template content that wasn't relevant to research focus
decision_log.impact: paper.md front matter, structure, and build commands updated for research context

decision_log.decision: Preserve comprehensive 111-source bibliography with academic and industry citations
decision_log.rationale: Strong evidence base requires both peer-reviewed academic sources and real-world industry implementations to support conversational AI adoption arguments
alternatives: Focus only on peer-reviewed academic sources
Separate academic and industry citations into different sections
Reduce citation count for brevity
decision_log.tradeoffs: Gained: comprehensive evidence base, credibility. Lost: some document brevity and focus
decision_log.impact: References section spans 111 sources across academic and industry categories

decision_log.decision: REVERSED: Adopt UV environment for YuiQuery research project
decision_log.rationale: Python 3.6 compatibility issue encountered when user ran scripts with anaconda Python 3.6 (subprocess.run text=True parameter not available). UV environment ensures Python 3.8+ compatibility and provides development consistency. While scripts have zero external dependencies, environment isolation prevents Python version compatibility issues.
alternatives: Continue with system Python and document Python 3.8+ requirement
Use requirements.txt with traditional venv
Add Python version checks to scripts
decision_log.tradeoffs: Gained: Python version consistency, development environment isolation, future-proof for package additions, resolved compatibility issues. Lost: some setup complexity, requires UV installation
decision_log.impact: Created pyproject.toml, .venv environment, updated scripts to use UV environment, documentation updated for UV setup

decision_log.decision: Reverse decision 2025-08-21-007 and implement UV environment
decision_log.rationale: Real-world compatibility issue discovered when user encountered Python 3.6 error: 'TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument text'. UV environment with Python 3.8+ required for subprocess.run(text=True) parameter. Practical issue overrides theoretical simplicity preference.
alternatives: Add Python version compatibility layer to scripts
Document Python 3.8+ system requirement
Use conditional subprocess calls based on Python version
decision_log.tradeoffs: Gained: immediate problem resolution, future-proof Python compatibility, development tool integration. Lost: initial simplicity ideal
decision_log.impact: Fixed Python 3.6 compatibility error, scripts now work reliably across environments, established development environment foundation

decision_log.decision: Implement bidirectional GitHub Issues ↔ TODO synchronization
decision_log.rationale: Original sync script was unidirectional (GitHub → TODO only) and failed with empty repositories. Bidirectional sync enables creating GitHub Issues from existing TODO tasks and maintains consistency between local and remote task management. Essential for academic project workflow where tasks may originate in either system.
alternatives: Keep unidirectional sync and manually create GitHub Issues
Use separate tools for GitHub Issue creation and TODO management
Implement GitHub Issues → TODO only with manual issue creation workflow
decision_log.tradeoffs: Gained: automatic GitHub Issue creation, true bidirectional consistency, works with empty repositories, seamless workflow. Lost: simpler unidirectional logic, slightly more complex error handling
decision_log.impact: Added load_existing_todo(), create_github_issue(), sync_to_github() methods, updated main() workflow, created 3 GitHub Issues from existing TODO tasks

decision_log.decision: Adopt UV package manager over traditional pip/venv for Python environment
decision_log.rationale: UV provides faster, more reliable Python environment management with better dependency resolution. Integrates well with modern Python development practices and provides consistent environments across team members. Supports both runtime and development dependencies with clear separation.
alternatives: Traditional pip + virtualenv approach
Poetry for dependency management
Conda environment management
System Python with requirements.txt
decision_log.tradeoffs: Gained: faster installation, better dependency resolution, modern tooling, team consistency. Lost: familiarity with traditional pip/venv, additional tool requirement
decision_log.impact: Created pyproject.toml, established .venv with UV, updated scripts for UV environment usage, documentation updated with UV setup instructions

decision_log.title: GitHub Issues Deduplication and Sync System Optimization
decision_log.description: Closed 50+ duplicate GitHub issues created by bidirectional sync system to establish clean task tracking
decision_log.decision: Systematically closed duplicate issues for completed work and consolidated remaining tasks to single issues each
decision_log.rationale: Bidirectional sync was creating 4+ duplicates per task, cluttering project management dashboard. Clean tracking essential for September 30 Paper 1 deadline and executive reporting.
alternatives_considered: Keep all duplicate issues and manage manually
Create separate tracking systems for different task types
Rebuild entire issue tracking from scratch
decision_log.tradeoffs: Gained: clean project dashboard, accurate task counts, clear executive reporting, focused team attention. Lost: some historical tracking granularity, need to re-sync TODO files
decision_log.impact: Closed issues #15-35, #47-99 duplicates, established 20 genuine remaining tasks, improved project management clarity
